title: Once upon a time
creator_contributor_role: Film Workshop, Central Office of Information, production company
subject_group: Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Clock and watch making
Hobbies, Recreation & Sport/Clock and watch making
Mathematics, Science & Technology/Time - Systems and standards
Crafts & Visual Arts/Clock and watch making
description: A story of Britain's contribution to the art of clock-making. The Greenwich Observatory was established during the reign of Charles II.; in 1764 a clock was made which would keep time for months on board ships, and so the problem of longitude was solved. Today, in the age of mass production, Britain's clockwork industry maintains its high standards of precision and reliability.
